FuncDef: The patch delete command deletes patches from the current system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specify the patch file name.
The value is a string of 5 to 63 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

Deletes all patches on all the boards.
-

Examples: This will delete the patch. Are you sure? [Y/N]:y
Info: Operating, please wait for a moment....done.
This will delete the patch. Are you sure? [Y/N]:y
Info: Operating, please wait for a moment.......done.
* Warning: Perform the following operations to deal with the cold patch.   *
Info: Succeeded in deleting the patch.
This will delete the patch. Are you sure? [Y/N]:y
Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...done.
Info: Succeeded in deleting the patch.
This will delete the patch. Are you sure? [Y/N]:y
Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before installing a non-incremental patch, you can run the patch delete command to delete a specified patch from the current system by specifying the patch file name, and then install a new patch package.
Configuration Impact
After the patch delete command is run, patches on the system are deleted regardless of their status.
Precautions
This command applies only to the admin VS but takes effect on all VSs.
The patch delete command may affect the performance of the system. So, confirm the action before you use this command.When the patch delete command is run to delete patches from the current system, the system prompts you whether to delete patches.After the patch delete command is run to delete existing patches from the current system, the deleted patches cannot be restored. So, confirm the action before you use this command.If a patch operation is performed when the CPU or memory usage is too high, risks may exist.
